title: How to Make Michigan Sauce

steps.headline: Gather all the seasonings or spices, the hot sauce, and tomato sauce.
steps.description: Combine them into a large saucepan and mix them together.

steps.headline: Mash the raw ground beef into the mixture, using a potato masher while cooking everything.
Cook the tomato beef mixture until the beef is browned.
steps.description: Cover the pan and let it simmer for 2 to 3 hours on low heat.

steps.headline: Serve the sauce over hot dogs.

text: Gather all the seasonings or spices, the hot sauce, and tomato sauce. Combine them into a large saucepan and mix them together. Mash the raw ground beef into the mixture, using a potato masher while cooking everything.  Cook the tomato beef mixture until the beef is browned. Cover the pan and let it simmer for 2 to 3 hours on low heat. Serve the sauce over hot dogs.
